verses.verse: The famine <S%H410><s%> was <S%H7706><s%> severe <S%H5414><s%> in the <S%H7356><s%> land. <S%H6440><s%>

It happened, <S%H3615><s%> when they had eaten up the grain <S%H7668><s%> which they had brought out <S%H935><s%> of Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> their father <S%H1><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H7725><s%> "Go again, buy <S%H7666><s%> us a little <S%H4592><s%> more food. <S%H400><s%>"

Judah <S%H3063><s%> spoke <S%H559><s%> to him, <S%H559><s%> saying, "The man <S%H376><s%> solemnly <S%H5749><s%> warned <S%H5749><s%> us, <S%H559><s%> saying, <S%H7200><s%> 'You shall not see my face, <S%H6440><s%> unless <S%H1115><s%> your brother is with you. <S%H251><s%>'
If you <S%H3426><s%>'ll send <S%H7971><s%> our brother <S%H251><s%> with us, <S%H3381><s%> we'll go down and buy <S%H7666><s%> you food, <S%H400><s%>

but if you <S%H7971><s%>'ll not send him, <S%H3381><s%> we'll not go down, for the man <S%H376><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to us, <S%H7200><s%> 'You shall not see my face, <S%H6440><s%> unless your brother is with you. <S%H251><s%>'"
Israel <S%H3478><s%> said, <S%H559><s%> "Why did you treat me so badly, <S%H7489><s%> telling <S%H5046><s%> the man <S%H376><s%> that you had another brother? <S%H251><s%>"

They said, <S%H559><s%> "The man <S%H376><s%> asked <S%H7592><s%> directly <S%H7592><s%> concerning ourselves, <S%H4138><s%> and concerning our relatives, saying, <S%H559><s%> <S%H1><s%> 'Is your father still alive? <S%H2416><s%> Have you <S%H3426><s%> another brother? <S%H251><s%>' We just <S%H5046><s%> answered <S%H5921><s%> his <S%H6310><s%> questions. <S%H1697><s%> Is there any way we could <S%H3045><s%> know <S%H3045><s%> that he would say, <S%H559><s%> <S%H3381><s%> 'Bring your brother <S%H251><s%> down? <S%H3381><s%>'"

Judah <S%H3063><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to Israel, <S%H3478><s%> his father, <S%H1><s%> "Send <S%H7971><s%> the boy <S%H5288><s%> with me, <S%H6965><s%> and we'll get up and go, <S%H3212><s%> so that we may live, <S%H2421><s%> and not die, <S%H4191><s%> both we, <S%H2945><s%> and you, and also our little ones.

I <S%H6148><s%>'ll be collateral for him. <S%H3027><s%> From my hand will you require <S%H1245><s%> him. <S%H518><s%> If I don't <S%H518><s%> bring <S%H935><s%> him to you, <S%H6440><s%> and set <S%H3322><s%> him before you, <S%H6440><s%> then let me bear the blame forever, <S%H2398><s%>
for if we hadn't <S%H3884><s%> delayed, <S%H4102><s%> surely we would have returned <S%H7725><s%> a second time by now. <S%H6471><s%>"

Their father, <S%H1><s%> Israel, <S%H3478><s%> said <S%H559><s%> to them, <S%H645><s%> "If it must be so, then do <S%H6213><s%> this. <S%H3947><s%> Take from the choice fruits <S%H2173><s%> of the land <S%H776><s%> in your bags, <S%H3627><s%> and carry down <S%H3381><s%> a present <S%H4503><s%> for the man, <S%H376><s%> a little <S%H4592><s%> balm, <S%H6875><s%> a little <S%H4592><s%> honey, <S%H1706><s%> spices <S%H5219><s%> and myrrh, <S%H3910><s%> nuts, <S%H992><s%> and almonds; <S%H8247><s%>

and take <S%H3947><s%> double <S%H4932><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> in your hand, <S%H3027><s%> and take <S%H7725><s%> back <S%H3027><s%> the money <S%H3701><s%> that was returned <S%H7725><s%> in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of your sacks. <S%H572><s%> Perhaps it was an oversight. <S%H4870><s%>
Take <S%H3947><s%> your brother <S%H251><s%> also, <S%H6965><s%> get up, and return <S%H7725><s%> to the man. <S%H376><s%>

May God <S%H410><s%> Almighty <S%H7706><s%> give <S%H5414><s%> you mercy <S%H7356><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> the man, <S%H376><s%> that he may release <S%H7971><s%> to you your other <S%H312><s%> brother <S%H251><s%> and Benjamin. <S%H1144><s%> If <S%H834><s%> I am bereaved <S%H7921><s%> of my children, <S%H7921><s%> I am bereaved."

The men <S%H582><s%> took <S%H3947><s%> that <S%H2063><s%> present, <S%H4503><s%> and they took <S%H3947><s%> double <S%H4932><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> in their hand, <S%H3027><s%> and Benjamin; <S%H1144><s%> and got up, <S%H6965><s%> went down <S%H3381><s%> to Egypt, <S%H4714><s%> and stood <S%H5975><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> Joseph. <S%H3130><s%>

When Joseph <S%H3130><s%> saw <S%H7200><s%> Benjamin <S%H1144><s%> with <S%H854><s%> them, <S%H559><s%> he said to the steward of his house, <S%H1004><s%> "Bring <S%H935><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> into the house, <S%H1004><s%> and butcher <S%H2873><s%> an animal, <S%H3559><s%> and prepare; for the men <S%H582><s%> will dine <S%H398><s%> with me at noon. <S%H6672><s%>"

The man <S%H376><s%> did <S%H6213><s%> as Joseph <S%H3130><s%> commanded, <S%H559><s%> and the man <S%H376><s%> brought <S%H935><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> to Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s house. <S%H1004><s%>

The men <S%H582><s%> were afraid, <S%H3372><s%> because they were brought <S%H935><s%> to Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s house; <S%H1004><s%> and they said, <S%H559><s%> "Because <S%H1697><s%> of the money <S%H3701><s%> that was returned <S%H7725><s%> in our sacks <S%H572><s%> at the first time, <S%H8462><s%> we <S%H935><s%>'re brought in; that he may seek occasion <S%H1556><s%> against us, <S%H5307><s%> attack us, <S%H3947><s%> and seize us as slaves, <S%H5650><s%> along with our donkeys. <S%H2543><s%>"
They came near <S%H5066><s%> to the steward <S%H376><s%> of Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s house, <S%H1004><s%> and they spoke <S%H1696><s%> to him at the door <S%H6607><s%> of the house, <S%H1004><s%>
and said, <S%H559><s%> "Oh, <S%H994><s%> my lord, <S%H113><s%> we indeed <S%H3381><s%> came down <S%H3381><s%> the first time <S%H8462><s%> to buy <S%H7666><s%> food. <S%H400><s%>

When we came <S%H935><s%> to the lodging place, <S%H4411><s%> we opened <S%H6605><s%> our sacks, <S%H572><s%> and behold, <S%H376><s%> each man's money <S%H3701><s%> was in the mouth <S%H6310><s%> of his sack, <S%H572><s%> our money <S%H3701><s%> in full weight. <S%H4948><s%> We have brought it back <S%H7725><s%> in our hand. <S%H3027><s%>

We have brought down <S%H3381><s%> other <S%H312><s%> money <S%H3701><s%> in our hand <S%H3027><s%> to buy <S%H7666><s%> food. <S%H400><s%> We don't <S%H3045><s%> know who put <S%H7760><s%> our money <S%H3701><s%> in our sacks. <S%H572><s%>"

He said, <S%H559><s%> "Peace <S%H7965><s%> be to you. <S%H3372><s%> Don't be afraid. Your God, <S%H430><s%> and the God <S%H430><s%> of your father, <S%H1><s%> has given <S%H5414><s%> you treasure <S%H4301><s%> in your sacks. <S%H572><s%> I received <S%H935><s%> your money. <S%H3701><s%>" He brought <S%H3318><s%> Simeon out to them. <S%H8095><s%>

The man <S%H376><s%> brought <S%H935><s%> the men <S%H582><s%> into Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s house, <S%H1004><s%> and gave <S%H5414><s%> them water, <S%H4325><s%> and they washed <S%H7364><s%> their feet. <S%H7272><s%> He gave <S%H5414><s%> their donkeys <S%H2543><s%> fodder. <S%H4554><s%>

They prepared <S%H3559><s%> the present <S%H4503><s%> for <S%H5704><s%> Joseph <S%H3130><s%>'s coming <S%H935><s%> at noon, <S%H6672><s%> for they heard <S%H8085><s%> that they should eat <S%H398><s%> bread there. <S%H3899><s%>

When Joseph <S%H3130><s%> came <S%H935><s%> home, <S%H1004><s%> they brought <S%H935><s%> him the present <S%H4503><s%> which was in their hand <S%H3027><s%> into the house, <S%H1004><s%> and bowed <S%H7812><s%> themselves down to him to the earth. <S%H776><s%>

He asked <S%H7592><s%> them of their welfare, <S%H7965><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Is your father <S%H1><s%> well, <S%H7965><s%> the old man <S%H2205><s%> of whom you spoke? <S%H559><s%> Is he yet alive? <S%H2416><s%>"
They said, <S%H559><s%> "Your servant, <S%H5650><s%> our father, <S%H1><s%> is well. <S%H7965><s%> He is still alive. <S%H2416><s%>" They bowed <S%H6915><s%> down humbly. <S%H7812><s%>

He lifted up <S%H5375><s%> his eyes, <S%H5869><s%> and saw <S%H7200><s%> Benjamin, <S%H1144><s%> his brother, <S%H251><s%> his mother <S%H517><s%>'s son, <S%H1121><s%> and said, <S%H559><s%> "Is this your youngest <S%H6996><s%> brother, <S%H251><s%> of whom you spoke <S%H559><s%> to me? <S%H559><s%>" He said, "God <S%H430><s%> be gracious <S%H2603><s%> to you, <S%H1121><s%> my son."

Joseph <S%H3130><s%> hurried, <S%H4116><s%> for his heart <S%H7356><s%> yearned <S%H3648><s%> over his brother; <S%H251><s%> and he sought <S%H1245><s%> a place to weep. <S%H1058><s%> He entered <S%H935><s%> into his room, <S%H2315><s%> and wept there. <S%H1058><s%>
He washed <S%H7364><s%> his face, <S%H6440><s%> and came out. <S%H3318><s%> He controlled <S%H662><s%> himself, <S%H559><s%> and said, "Serve the <S%H7760><s%> meal. <S%H3899><s%>"

They served <S%H7760><s%> him by himself, <S%H4713><s%> and them by themselves, and the Egyptians, that ate <S%H398><s%> with him, <S%H4713><s%> by themselves, because the Egyptians don't <S%H3201><s%> eat <S%H398><s%> bread <S%H3899><s%> with the Hebrews, <S%H5680><s%> for that is an abomination <S%H8441><s%> to the Egyptians. <S%H4714><s%>

They sat <S%H3427><s%> before him, <S%H6440><s%> the firstborn <S%H1060><s%> according to his birthright, <S%H1062><s%> and the youngest <S%H6810><s%> according to his youth, <S%H6812><s%> and the men <S%H582><s%> marveled <S%H8539><s%> one <S%H376><s%> with another. <S%H7453><s%>

He sent <S%H5375><s%> portions <S%H4864><s%> to them from before him, <S%H6440><s%> but Benjamin <S%H1144><s%>'s portion <S%H4864><s%> was five <S%H2568><s%> times <S%H3027><s%> as much as <S%H7235><s%> any of theirs. <S%H8354><s%> They drank, and were merry with him. <S%H7937><s%>
